title: Spending on Children Surged During the Pandemic. It Didn’t Last.
description: As programs expire, such federal spending is returning to prior levels: $1 for every $6 spent on older adults.
dc:creator: Claire Cain Miller
media:credit: Timothy Mulcare for The New York Times
media:description: “In my career, I’ve never seen anything so dramatic as the shift in resources to families with kids during the pandemic,” a Michigan professor said.
